title: For Sale/Trade:  Very Rare Low Mileage Russian Ural Dnepr K-650 Sidecar Motorcycle
postcontent:
For Sale: Very Rare and Low Mileage / Kilometers (49 actual kilometers) Russian Ural / Dnepr K-650 Sidecar Motorcycle in almost new condition. This bike is a rare piece of history and is truly in unbelievable condition - pictures do not do it justice. I've done quite a bit of research on these bikes and according to the numbers on the engine and frame, this bike was manufactured in the early to mid 1980's and appears to be a MT-11 Dnepr. The MT-16 is the 2 wheel drive version of the motorcycle. The Ural's and Dnepr's were manufactured almost to exact replicas to the BMW's. Versions of this motorcycle are still manufactured to this date. The Ural's and Dnepr's are practically the same bikes just manufactured in different plants and locations in Russia. Motorcycle has all parts and pieces that it originally came with including mud guards for the front section of the motorcycle, original hand pump, sidecar leather cover, seat, etc. that are also in great condition. This motorcycle was in stored in conditioned space for many years and it shows. I've included a bit of history on these bikes below if you do not know much about them. In a nutshell, the Russians basically duplicated the WWII BMW sidecar motorcycles verbatim and most of the parts are exactly the same. I would love to keep this bike but I have too many bikes and don't have the room for this one. Please don't ask as I will not separate the sidecar from the motorcycle. 

This bike is equipped with the 12 volt system and reverse. All lights, signals, horn, etc. work as you can see in the link below to the video of the bike running and driving. 

You can look around a long time and not find a bike that this nice and that has been properly maintained like this bike has been. This motorcycle gets a lot of attention and lookers. There might be cheaper and newer bikes out there but to find one that is in this condition and well maintained is hard to find. This bike will hold its value for years to come. 

Motorcycle is being sold As-Is with clean and clear title in hand. Don't waste your and my time with bogus emails, text messages or low ball offers. Bike has been paid for and this is not a desperate situation. I will not respond to bogus emails or text messages. If this ad is still up, the bike is still for sale. I will delete the ad as soon as the bike sells. 

Videos of the bike running and driving below:
http://s822.photobucket.com/user/ptrcomm/media/Ural/Ural6runninglightsvideo_zps86ae73ce.mp4.html

http://s822.photobucket.com/user/ptrcomm/media/Ural/Ural5drivingvideo_zpsde650366.mp4.html

HISTORY of the URAL
The history of the "URAL" brand motorcycle begins with the Russian pre W.W.II planning. Russia knew it would soon be going to war against the Third Reich, and Hitler. The military was ordered to gear up in all areas, including the ground forces that would be defending the Russian "motherland" from the invading German Panzer, ground troops, and German Special Forces. The German Special Forces had thousands of the BMW sidecars that the German Army loved for their maneuverability, reliability, economy and ease of maintenance. Carrying a machine gun and soldier plus supplies, the sidecar "weapon" was feared by the otherwise "fixed" Russian ground troops. The usefulness of the sidecar motorcycle was beginning its legend.

Back in the old USSR, in 1939, the Russian engineers in Moscow were busily dismantling 5 BMWs purchased from Germany through some Swedish intermediaries. The engineers copied the BMW design in all details and made molds and dies to produce their own engines and gearboxes in Moscow. (Incidentally, Harley-Davidson also copied the BMW and delivered about 1,000 Harley-Davidson model XA flat-twin shaft drive motorcycles to the US Army during World War II.) Soon a factory was set up in Moscow producing hundreds of Russian sidecar motorcycles. At this point the rig had no name. As the demand and function for the Russian sidecar rig spread in the military, the top Russian
strategists worried that the factory in Moscow was within easy range of German bombers. The decision was made to move the motorcycle plant further east, out of bombing range and into the middle of the resource rich "URAL" mountain region. 

A site was chosen in the small trading town of Irbit, located on the fringe of the Siberian plains. The only building on the site was a brewery and it soon was converted into the first R & D building to prepare for the construction of a massive new production complex to build the "URAL" motorcycle. Over 5,000 "URALs" as they came to be known in the military, (they still had no official name) were produced for the Russian Army during W.W.II. They fought against the Germans in many sectors and battles and must have mightily surprised the German sidecar gunners when they came up against Russians riding the "look alike" and even stronger sidecar BMW clones!

The history of the URAL had begun with the glory of helping to defeat the terror of Hitler's armies on the Russian and European battlegrounds. 

The URAL was built for the military only, up until the late 1950's when another plant in the Ukraine was built to take on that job and the Irbit Motorcycle Works (IMZ) began to concentrate on bikes for domestic consumption. The popularity of the rigs grew steadily with the Russian people and in the 1960's the full production of the plant was turned over to non-military production.

History of Dnepr 
(Russian: Днепр, Ukrainian: Дніпро; Dnepr) is the brand name of heavy motorcycles produced in Kiev, Ukraine. Motorcycles have been produced in Kiev since 1946 at the Kiev Motorcycle Plant (Kievski Mototsikletnyi Zavod (KMZ), Киeвский Мотоциклетный Завод, (КМЗ)). Initial production was of a 98 cc two-stroke model that was confiscated from the German firm Wanderer as reparations. The original design for KMZ heavy motorcycles, and their cousin the IMZ, is taken from the pre-World War II German BMW motorcycle R71, which the Soviet Union licensed in 1940. The plant and equipment needed to make the M-72 (the Soviet derivative of the BMW R71) was transferred from the Gorkiy Motorcycle Plant (Gorkovkiy Mototsikletnyi Zavod, GMZ located in the city of Gorkiy (Nizhny Novgorod) in 1949. The first batch of M-72 motorcycles was produced in 1952 with the supply of 500 engines from IMZ. In 1958 KMZ replaced the plunger framed M72-N with the swingarm framed K-750. In 1964, KMZ introduced a military model, the MV-750 with a differential two-wheel drive to the sidecar wheel. In 1967, to celebrate the 50th Anniversary of the Great October Socialist Revolution, KMZ released their first OHV engine in the "Dnepr" K-650. Unlike the earlier sidevalve engines with their roller bearing crankshafts, this engine featured a sleeve bearing crankshaft as found in the World War II Zündapp KS750. The K-650 was superseded by model MT-9 650 cc, which was available in both solo and sidecar models (often referred to as the best "Cossack") as it was reliable and featured a new transmission with reverse gear and an automatic declutching mechanism incorporated into the riders foot pedal. The MT-10 was the first Soviet motorcycle to feature 12 volt electrics. The Dnepr is famous for its off-road capability. Armed services models equipped with sidecars had two-wheel drive and as much as 15 cm (5.9 in) of ground clearance. The present engine is a 650 cc OHV boxer twin. Modern models are sold with engines ranging from the factory standard 650 to 750 and 1,000 cc. These motorcycles have featured in many films like Indiana Jones and used prominently in the movie Garden State, with Zach Braff. Between 1973 and 1979 Dnepr was one of the makes marketed by Satra in the United Kingdom as Cossack motorcycles. Since demise of U.S.S.R. the factory had fallen on very hard times. Production decreased to only remnants of former glory. All shops were closed, and machine tools were taken out of the city limits.

title: For Sale:  Colt MKIV Series 70 Gold Cup National Match, Collector Grade, .45 ACP
location: South Charlotte, Ballantyne/Stonecrest area, Charlotte, North Carolina
postcontent:
Nothing is perfect, but if you are looking for a Colt MKIV Series 70, Gold Cup National Match for your collection, you are not likely to find a nicer example than this.  This was made in 1972 when Colt fit, finish and accuracy were still outstanding.  Comes with original Colt box, manual and three headed Colt screwdriver.  (I bought this thinking I would shoot it, but after looking at it repeatedly, I could not bring myself to do it.  This is for a collector, and that is not me.)  I can supply additional photos for serious inquiries.  From a cosmetic standpoint, the only blemishes are small rub marks on the side of the grip safety from grabbing/holding the pistol, and the underside of the frame in front of the trigger guard has a couple small rub marks.  Very slight take down line.  Grips with gold Colt medallions are as good as they get.  Naturally, has the Elliason adjustable rear sight. Very low round count based on inspection.

You must have a handgun purchase permit or concealed carry permit in order to purchase this gun.  I will supply a basic bill of sale and request you supply a photo copy of your drivers license and permit.  Cash only. No trades, thank you.  Prefer to deal on a face to face basis, but can ship at your expense if paid in full up front.

Last thought.  If you look on Gunbroker.com and other web sites, you can find a Series 70 Gold Cup NM for a couple hundred less, if you are patient.  If you are looking for a shooter, you should look for one of those.  I seriously doubt you will find one in this condition for less than $2,000 online, and if one of the fine gun stores in the area had this Colt in their store, they would have it marked at $2,500 or more.   Thanks for looking.

title: For Sale:  Original Charter Arms Pit Bull 9mm Federal
postcontent: This is the original Charter Arms Pit Bull, chambered for the 9mm Federal rimmed cartridge.  These guns are fairly rare, as they were only made from 1989-1991.  You can fire regular 9mm from it, but the cases will not extract.  You CAN fire .38 S&W (not .38 Special) from it, and those will function just fine.  Really just and oddball collector piece.  Box and papers as you can see.  This will NOT function with 9mm in moon clips.  You could have the back of the cylinder milled, and then it would.

The best way to describe the gun is to borrow directly from Ed Brown’s website: One of the most beautiful and unique pistols of all time, the Ed Brown 1911 .45 Kobra pistol packs all the power and precision of Ed Brown firearms into a sleek and stylish form. Similar in almost all respects to the Executive Elite, this Ed Brown pistol features: • Forged frame and slide • 5” Government model slid • Unloaded Weight; 38 oz • Dehorn package • Lowered and flared ejection port • Polished feedramp • Ed Brown premium match-grade barrel and solid steel bushing • Ed Brown memory groove beavertail grip safety and extended tactical thumb safety • Fixed Novak low-mount dovetail 3-dot night sights Arguably the most stunning aspect of the Ed Brown 1911 .45 Kobra, the forestrap, mainspring housing, and rear of the slide on this gun has Ed Brown’s exclusive SNAKESKIN treatment, which looks, as the name suggests, very close to a snake’s skin. Gorgeous, unique, and snag-free, SNAKESKIN provides the perfect gripping surface as well as cosmetic beauty. Whether you’re going to the range or using it for personal protection, you’re sure to be impressed by the perfect precision and performance of this Ed Brown 1911 .45 pistol

title: For Sale:  Custom Gun Stippling Services
postcontent:
Hello All,

Now with more than 3 years of custom gun stippling under my belt, I'm now opening the service to all interested.  I provide custom gun stippling for handguns, magazines, rifles, etc.

If you're interested in having a custom design done on your gun, just let me know.  I have quick turn around and excellent prices.  

For those of you that might not be familiar with gun stippling, it's a process where you manipulate the polymer portion of your guns to create a more aggressive grip and in some cases do so in areas that aren't textured from the manufacturer.

It's main purpose is to add extra gripping ability during all types of conditions, gives you better feel of the weapon during firing, which as you know makes for better accuracy.  

Doesn't matter if you have wet hands, sweaty hands, gloves on, etc.  My custom stippling and texturizing makes it easier for you to hold your weapon on target.  

Below you will see just three of the most popular designs, but I offer much more.  I can do designs specific to your needs as well.  My designs also take into consideration your shooting style, left or right handed and how you draw it from your holster. 

To get a quote, feel free to email me and I'll get you taken care of right away.

Thanks again and hope we can add that custom look and enhanced weapon control element to your gun.

title: For Sale:  Permit To Carry and Concealed Carry Class (Multi-State!)
postcontent:
http://civilresponse.net

March 2nd, 2014
Wanamingo, MN

This class qualifies for your Minnesota permit to carry certificate which is also valid in other states like Florida, Arizona, Wisconsin and Iowa, to name a few.

Learn more than the minimum that is required by state law to legally carry a firearm in public. The classes at Civil Response Firearms Training LLC offer students valuable information, such as; avoiding violent encounters, how to clear common firearm malfunctions, cleaning and maintenance of firearms, advice on choosing a handgun, less lethal alternatives, accessories, and much more.  We hope that our course can be educational and be found to be extremely valuable even if you never plan on carrying a handgun.

If you need a handgun for the shooting qualification, we have some available to use free of charge.

There are currently no indoor ranges in the area, so please dress accordingly and bring appropriate gear for the weather. We will be doing the live fire exercise rain, snow, or shine as long as the conditions do not make shooting unsafe, in which case we will rescheduled for a later date or time.

We offer discounts to past and present Military (all branches) and Law Enforcement Officers as well.

For more information or to sign up, visit:
http://civilresponse.net

title: For Sale/Trade:  Colt Trooper Mk III .357MAG 6" barrel DA only
postcontent:
Why, you might be asking, do I claim it's double-action only when there's clearly a hammer spur right out there for all to see?

It's apparent that, some time before I came into possession of the gun, a bit of the hammer broke. Specifically: the part that engages the rest of the action to cock for SA fire chipped off. 

So: no single action. Still locks up fine and shoots true. I've put a few thousand rounds through in the last seven years and she just keeps rolling.

Always thought I'd eventually spend the $39 for a new hammer, but never got around to it. So here it is, for anyone who wants one of these at a price that reflects that future $39 + shipping potential.

In addition to the DA-only thing, it shows signs of wear (holster or other) on the bluing, and the right forward corner of the right-side grip appears to have broken off and been repaired with some kind of adhesive.

title: For Sale:  TA31RCO-M4CP
postcontent:
This scope was used by my brother-in-law overseas, it was well taken care of and looks brand new.  No scratches or defects (he kept a cover on it when not taking rounds).  

It is the TA31RCO-M4CP: Trijicon ACOG 4x32 Scope with BAC USMC Rifle Combat Optic (RCO) for the M4 and M4A1 (14.5 barrel) 

The TA31RCO is an Advanced Combat Optical Gunsight (ACOG) designed for the M4 and M4A1 weapon system (14.5 barrel). It provides the shooter with quick target acquisition at close combat ranges while providing enhanced target identification and hit probability out to 800 meters utilizing the Bullet Drop Compensator. The TA31RCO incorporates dual-illumination technology using a combination of fiber optics and self-luminous tritium. This allows the aiming point to be always illuminated without the use of batteries. The Tritium illuminates the aiming point in total darkness, and the fiber-optic self-adjusts reticle brightness during daylight according to ambient light conditions. This allows the operator to keep both eyes open while engaging targets and maintaining maximum situational awareness. Designed to the exact specifications of the United States Marine Corps, the unique reticle pattern provides the shooter with quick target acquisition at close combat ranges while providing enhanced target identification and hit probability out to 800 meters utilizing the Bullet Drop Compensator.

To see more specs it is this exact scope: https://www.trijicon.com/na_en/products/product3b.php?pid=TA31RCO-M4CP 

Willing to negotiate a little on price, it does have some meaning as it was used in combat in multiple engagements.  Still not sure how he kept it so pristine.  Willing to ship, enjoy.


The TA31RCO-M4CP also includes:
 1 Thumbscrew Flattop Adapter (TA51)
 1 4x32 RCO killFLASH®
1 Adjuster Cap Lanyards
 1 4x32 Scopecoat (TA96)

Because of these advantages and especially because of its copact size and dimensions, the GLOCK 19 is the first choice and one of the hotest sellers of the Glock Family.  Standard magazine capacity is 15 rounds but there are options for more. 
Looking for a like new Glock 19 in 9mm but with a lower than new price?  Here it is.  This firearm was returned to me from a guy that bought it a few years ago.  I took him to the range and we shot this gun.  I showed him how to shoot it, aim, basic pistol stuff, care, field strip it and to clean it.  We put it back in the box and he took it home with him.  He called me a week or so ago and said he didn't want it anymore that he felt it was just too much a liability for him to own.  He never shot it again after that day on the range.  This gun is really nice.

OUR TERMS and CONDITIONS - Handgun;
Buyer must be 21 years old for Handguns.  You must be legally able to own or possess a Handgun. Your FFL can send, (P.O. I wouldn't recommend cash but if you must send cash, go ahead, I'm honest and will accept cash as your payment.  Personal Checks must clear my bank and I will not ship until I get confirmation your check has cleared, usually about a 7 to 10 day wait after deposit. Certified Checks must also clear but usually have a shorter wait time. USPS Money Orders must also clear but usually very fast and sometimes I can cash them at the Post Office. All major Credit Cards are accepted, except Discover, but you must call me to give me your CC information, number, expiration date, CCV and Name on the card. There is a 3% up-fee/surcharge on Credit Cards on the full amount including shipping but as soon as the funds show up in my account I will ship. Usually about 24 hours.

Your payment is due in our hands or account within 7 calendar days after you agree to buy.  NO excuses, NO extensions accepted. Call me or e-mail with your information. If you do not pay within the 7 days as agreed I will re-post this firearm.  Your call or e-mail will not change this. Handguns, & Small firearms will be shipped USPS if I can.  Or I will ship it UPS or FedEx 2nd Day Air or Overnight for $27.00, paid by you so add $27.00 to the amount of the firearm for shipping.  Alaska is an extra $10.00 with a signature required on all firearms. Insurance and other shippers are optional and may cost extra.  I almost always add insurance to the shipping.

The name of my company is "Gid-R-Dun Rod and Gun" and we will Gid-R-Dun!

title: For Sale:  Glock 19 (gen2) with optional Crimson Trace Laser
postcontent:
I'm selling a 2nd generation, two-letter S/N indicating this is an early production Glock 19. I bought this as a safe queen and collectable as I was looking for one that was basically brand-new. This one is in great shape, has no carry wear and the frame is in almost-mint condition minus a small scuff on the nose. Everything is matching and original, up to and including the pre-upgrade black parts that Glock used in the early 1990's.

The reason I am selling it is because the slide lock notch has been worked on. Meaning, the notch that the slide lock lever locks into to lock the slide back has been filed to actuate an easier release if you use the slide lock lever to drop the slide. It is a small alteration, and does not impede function, however it is a modification that I didn't want as I literally wanted a 100% original, unaltered gen2 G19 for collecting purposes. See picture below.

I am looking for $600. No mag included as I don't have any prebans or 10rounders. I also have a Crimson Trace lasergrip (# LG619) that I am looking to sell separately for $175 which is in likewise excellent condition. If the buyer is interested in both I would do a package for $750 total. Many shops in MA charge $700 for just the G19 alone and often with carry wear.

Since I am a NH resident, this will need to be transferred through a MA FFL at the buyers expense. Buyer must hold a current/valid drivers license and Massachusetts Class A LTC, as well as agree to a bill of sale.
